signed: on underside, in blue glaze: (Made in the Kangxi Reign)
text: This pair of incised yellow-glazed bowls date to the early 20th century, made in the style of early Qing imperial wares. They are finely incised around the exterior with floral medallions divided by clouds. Above a lotus lappet band, the interior has a floral medallion, completely covered in a rich, egg-yolk yellow glaze save for the base glazed in white.
title: Bowl
